wikipedia_page.main: Harold Edwards (7 September 1909 – 1993), also known by the nickname of "The Welsh Bull", was a Welsh professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s and 1940s. He played at representative level for Wales, and at club level for Wigan (Heritage № 372) and Bradford Northern, as a prop, i.e. number 8 or 10, during the era of contested scrums.

response: Harold Edwards (rugby league) (1909–1993), Welsh rugby league footballer
* Harold Edwards won caps for Wales while at Wigan, and Bradford Northern 1935...1938 2-caps
